intro: Psychotria anceps, commonly known as the "blue hoya" or "blue psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria anceps is a climbing shrub that can grow up to several meters in length, using its aerial roots to attach to trees or other structures. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
